subject: Re: [junit] Test Everything, No Matter How Simple
msgSnippet: ... From the article: No code should be untested. Even the simplest code (like this almost trivial ... So you re recommending 100% code coverage? -- Cédric
messageBody:
On 8/22/06, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:
>
> FWIW, here's another small case study where testing first prevented a
> problem in code that was "too simple to fail":
>
> http://cafe.elharo.com/java/test-everything-no-matter-how-simple/


From the article:

No code should be untested. Even the simplest code (like this almost trivial
> setter method) can have bugs, so even the simplest code needs to be tested.
> No exceptions! No code is too simple to fail.


So you're recommending 100% code coverage?

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
